Identification.LongTitle: An Act to support the delivery of international financial assistance

ReaderNote.Note: [Enacted by section 659 of chapter 27 of the Statutes of Canada, 2018, in force June 23, 2019, see SI/2019-45.]

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the International Financial Assistance Act.

In this Act, competent minister means the Minister of Foreign Affairs, or the Minister for International Development for the purposes of the role described in section 4 of the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Act.

Subsection.Text: Subject to the regulations, for the purpose of supporting a federal sovereign loans program, the competent minister may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: make loans to a foreign state or to any person or entity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: acquire and hold security or a security interest, including, in Quebec, a right in a security, of any kind and in any form, for the due discharge of obligations with respect to loans under paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: surrender the security, security interest or right in the security and acquire and hold, in exchange, a security or security interest, including, in Quebec, a right in a security, of any kind and in any form;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: realize the security, security interest or right in the security made, acquired and held for the due discharge of obligations with respect to loans made under paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: exchange, assign, sell or otherwise dispose of the security, security interest or right in the security, of any kind and in any form, for the due discharge of obligations with respect to loans under paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: acquire, hold, assign, exchange, sell or otherwise dispose of shares within the meaning of paragraph 90(5)(e) of the Financial Administration Act.

Subsection.Text: Unless a loan referred to in paragraph (1)(a) is made to the government of a foreign state, it must be guaranteed by the government of a foreign state benefiting from the loan in favour of Her Majesty in right of Canada.

Section.Text: Subject to the regulations, for the purpose of supporting a federal program that promotes international assistance through the use of innovative financing, the competent minister may, directly or indirectly,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: guarantee, in whole or in part, any obligation undertaken by a person or entity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: acquire and hold security or a security interest, including, in Quebec, a right in a security, of any kind and in any form, for the due discharge of obligations guaranteed under paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: surrender the security, security interest or right in the security and acquire and hold, in exchange, a security or security interest, including, in Quebec, a right in a security, of any kind and in any form;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: realize the security, security interest or right in the security made, acquired and held with respect to obligations guaranteed under paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: exchange, assign, sell or otherwise dispose of the security, security interest or right in the security, of any kind and in any form, for the due discharge of obligations guaranteed under paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: acquire, hold, assign, exchange, sell or otherwise dispose of shares within the meaning of paragraph 90(5)(e) of the Financial Administration Act.

Section.Text: Subject to the regulations, for the purpose of supporting a federal international assistance program that promotes the mitigation of or adaptation to climate change through repayable contributions, the competent minister may, directly or indirectly, acquire, hold, assign, exchange, sell or otherwise dispose of shares within the meaning of paragraph 90(5)(e) of the Financial Administration Act.

Subsection.Text: The competent minister may charge fees and interest as determined under the regulations for the purposes of sections 3 and 4.
For greater certainty, the Service Fees Act does not apply to any fees or interest referred to in subsection (1).

The Surplus Crown Assets Act and section 61 of the Financial Administration Act do not apply with respect to the exercising and carrying out of the powers, duties and functions conferred to the competent minister under paragraphs 3(1)(b) to (f) and 4(b) to (f) and section 5.

For the purposes of section 90 of the Financial Administration Act, shares of a corporation that on acquisition would be held by, on behalf of or in trust for Her Majesty in right of Canada, may be acquired for the purposes of sections 3 to 5.

The Governor in Council may, on the recommendation of the Minister of Foreign Affairs and the Minister for International Development and with the concurrence of the Minister of Finance, make regulations for the purposes of sections 3 to 6, including regulations

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: establishing the maximum loan term, the terms and conditions of repayment and the manner in which applicable rates of interest are set;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the type of security referred to in paragraphs 3(1)(b) to (e) and 4(b) to (e);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the circumstances and the manner in which shares may be acquired, held, assigned, exchanged, sold or otherwise disposed of;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the maximum amount of outstanding guarantees;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the applicable fees or the manner in which fees are set, circumstances in which they are required and the manner in which fees are paid; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: providing that certain transactions or classes of transactions require consultation with or the approval of the Minister of Finance.

Subsection.Text: The regulations may establish classes of securities or guarantees and distinguish among those classes.
